content: Dad's birthday is March 15th. He'll be turning 62 this year.
Dad loves playing golf. He tries to play every Saturday morning with his buddies.
Dad's been frustrated with his golf game lately. He thinks it's his equipment holding him back.
I asked Dad what he wants for his birthday and he said 'something to help my golf game would be nice.'
Dad keeps saying his golf clubs are outdated. Especially his driver - it's ancient.
Dad complained last week that his driver is warped and he keeps slicing his shots.
Dad saw a Callaway ad during the PGA tour and said he'd love to try their new Paradym driver.
Dad's golf handicap is around 18. He's been trying to break 90 for years.
Mom mentioned she already got Dad a new watch for his birthday.
Dad's favorite color is navy blue. Most of his golf shirts are blue.
Dad retired from his engineering job last year. He's been golfing a lot more since.
For Christmas, we got Dad a nice golf bag. He really liked it.
Dad doesn't like surprise parties. He prefers small family dinners.
Dad's current driver is a TaylorMade from about 8 years ago.
Dad and I played golf together last month. He was frustrated with his long game.
Dad reads Golf Digest magazine. He always has one in the bathroom.
Dad's golf buddies are Tom, Jerry, and Mike. They've been playing together for 20 years.
Last year for Dad's birthday I got him golf balls. He said he always needs more.
Dad mentioned his putter is fine but his woods need replacing.
Dad watches the Golf Channel constantly. It drives Mom crazy.
Dad's home golf course is Pine Valley. His locker number is 247.
Dad doesn't like gadgets. He refused to get a golf GPS watch.
Dad's dream is to play Pebble Beach someday. It's on his bucket list.
Mom's birthday is June 22nd. She's turning 59 this year.
Mom loves gardening. She spends hours in the backyard every weekend.
Mom's been wanting a new set of pruning shears. Hers are rusty.
For Mom's last birthday, I got her a nice cookbook. She uses it all the time.
Mom said she wants 'something practical' for her birthday this year.
Mom's favorite flowers are tulips. Dad always forgets this.
Mom hates golf. She thinks it's boring and takes up too much of Dad's time.
I started a new job at the marketing agency last month. It's been hectic but exciting.
My apartment lease is up in August. I need to decide if I'm renewing or moving.
I've been trying to learn Spanish using Duolingo. Day 45 streak so far.
My friend Sarah is getting married in October. I need to book flights to Denver.
I finally finished reading that book on stoicism. Really changed my perspective.
My car needs new brakes. The mechanic quoted me $400.
I signed up for a half marathon in May. Need to start training seriously.
My sister just announced she's pregnant. The baby is due in September.
I've been binge-watching that new sci-fi series on Netflix. It's addictive.
My coworker Mike recommended a great Italian restaurant downtown. Need to try it.
I finally paid off my student loans last month. What a relief.
The coffee maker broke this morning. Had to stop at Starbucks.
I'm thinking about getting a cat. The apartment feels lonely sometimes.
My gym membership expires next week. Debating if I should renew or try home workouts.
Dad made his famous chili last Sunday. It was as good as ever.
Dad used to coach my little league team. Some of my best childhood memories.
Dad still drives the same old Toyota Camry. He refuses to upgrade.
Dad has a bad knee from an old skiing injury. It acts up in cold weather.
Dad's been talking about taking a trip to Scotland to play St Andrews.
Dad loves classic rock. His favorite band is Led Zeppelin.
Dad grills steaks every Fourth of July. It's become a family tradition.
Dad's allergic to shellfish. We always have to check restaurant menus carefully.
Dad worked at Boeing for 35 years before retiring. He was a mechanical engineer.
Mom and Dad are planning a cruise to Alaska for their anniversary.
I remember Dad teaching me to ride a bike in the driveway. I was terrified.
Dad always falls asleep during movies. It's a running joke in our family.
The weather has been terrible this week. Rain every single day.
I need to call the dentist. It's been way too long since my last checkup.
My neighbor's dog won't stop barking at night. I'm losing sleep.
I tried that new Thai place on 5th street. The pad thai was mediocre.
My phone battery is dying so fast lately. Might need to replace it.
I've been meaning to clean out my closet. There's stuff from college still in there.
Mom makes the best apple pie. She uses grandma's secret recipe.
Mom's been taking pottery classes. She made me a lopsided mug I love.
Mom worries too much about everything. Dad says she's always been that way.
Mom got a new puppy last month. A golden retriever named Biscuit.
The family reunion is scheduled for August at Uncle Bob's lake house.
My brother got promoted to senior manager. Mom won't stop bragging about it.
Grandma's 90th birthday is coming up. We're planning a big party.
Dad bought Mom a Peloton for Christmas. She's actually using it daily.
I had a weird dream about flying last night. Woke up feeling strange.
My favorite coffee shop closed down. I'm devastated.
I should really start meditating. Everyone says it helps with stress.
The stock market has been crazy lately. Glad I'm not checking my 401k.
I bought a new plant for my desk. Hoping I don't kill this one too.
Dad taught me how to change a tire when I was 16. Said it was essential life skills.
Dad's shed is full of tools he never uses. Mom wants him to clean it out.
Dad has a collection of old vinyl records. Mostly 70s rock albums.
Dad refuses to use the dishwasher. He insists on hand washing everything.
Dad's been growing tomatoes in the garden. They're actually pretty good.
Dad makes terrible jokes. We groan but secretly love them.
Dad's morning routine is exactly the same every day. Coffee at 6am sharp.
